channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Massive Medicaid fraud scheme puts Minnesota’s federal funding at risk — and fallout could widen
item.description: Minnesota faces potential federal Medicaid funding cuts over alleged fraud schemes, amid multiple ongoing investigations into the matter.

item.title: Deloitte’s CTO on a stunning AI transformation stat: companies are spending 93% on tech and only 7% on people
item.description: Bill Briggs recognizes an old inertia inside the boardroom: "I felt it in my travels, but I hadn't been able to quantify it."

item.title: Fed chair favorite Kevin Hassett on potential independence from Trump: ‘His opinion matters if it’s good, if it’s based on data’
item.description: On Friday, Trump said he “certainly should have a role" in Fed policy. "I’ve done great. I’ve made a lot of money ... I think my voice should be heard...

item.title: Rob Reiner, comedy legend who directed ‘When Harry Met Sally’ and ‘Spinal Tap,’ dead at 78
item.description: Reiner and his wife, Michele Singer, were found dead Sunday at their home in the Brentwood neighborhood of Los Angeles.

item.title: Making nightmares into reality: AI finds fans in the Islamic State, other militant and terrorist other groups worldwide
item.description: “One of the best things about AI is how easy it is to use,” said someone on a pro-IS site last month.

item.title: Italian cuisine, and even the rituals surrounding it, get an official UNESCO world heritage designation
item.description: “This tradition of being at the table, of stopping for a while at lunch, a bit longer at dinner ... it’s not very common around the world."

item.title: Small Business Administration unveils new initiative to roll back federal regulations
item.description: SBA unveils new initiative targeting Biden-era regulations that imposed $6 trillion in compliance costs on American families and small firms nationwid...

item.title: Sen. Raphael Warnock: A nation that tolerates mass shootings is 'in need of moral repair'
item.description: Sen. Raphael Warnock said that Saturday's deadly shooting at Brown University is yet another reminder that America's leaders need to do more to stop g...

item.title: So Jasmine Crockett Is Republicans’ Fault Now?
item.description: Media-amplified allegations that the GOP tricked her into running for Senate give the egotistical Texas rep far too little credit.

item.title: House Republicans set to vote on 'responsible alternative' to Obamacare
item.description: The House will vote this week on a Republican health care package that Speaker Mike Johnson said will provide "clear, responsible alternatives" to Oba...

item.title: Trump encourages Jewish Americans to 'celebrate proudly' during Hanukkah after deadly Bondi Beach shooting
item.description: President Donald Trump tells American Jews to "celebrate proudly" after deadly Bondi Beach attack on "Hanukkah by the Sea" event kills 11, injures doz...

item.title: China’s missile surge puts every US base in the Pacific at risk — and the window to respond is closing
item.description: China's massive missile force threatens U.S. Pacific bases as both nations race to build long-range weapons. Experts analyze the strategic competition...

item.title: Sen. Jim Banks predicts Trump's redistricting foes face tough primary cycle in Indiana
item.description: Sen. Jim Banks warned Sunday that Indiana Republicans who thwarted President Trump's push for a new redistricting map will pay for it in the spring GO...

item.title: The Feasts and Food of Advent
item.description: A season of joyful preparation leads us to Christmas.

item.title: 'Not a priority': GOP Sen. Bill Cassidy criticizes FDA's delay on mifepristone study
item.description: Sen. Bill Cassidy said Sunday the Trump administration isn't treating abortion drug safety as a priority.

item.title: Trump addresses trio of attacks in Syria, Brown University and Australia at White House Christmas event
item.description: President Donald Trump offered his condolences to the victims of a trio of attacks at Brown University, in Sydney, Australia, and in Syria on Sunday.

item.title: What a Bodega Taught the Socialist
item.description: Zohran Mamdani now says he wants to cut red tape for NYC small businesses. He should apply that epiphany across the board.

item.title: The True Toll of Conspiracy Theories
item.description: I witnessed Charlie Kirk’s murder. Conspiracy theorists are only making this heinous act worse.

item.title: GOP Sen. Rand Paul warns the Trump-led redistricting battle could fuel 'more violence'
item.description: Sen. Rand Paul is sounding the alarm over President Trump's nationwide redistricting push -- and the Democrats' counterattacks.

item.title: The Florida Highwaymen: Outsider Art, Tourism, and American Landscape
item.description: The fascinating story of black artists whose flamboyant colors, ocean waves, and swaying palms defined Florida for a generation of tourists.

item.title: Indiana’s Redistricting Surrender Illustrates Why Primaries Matter
item.description: The phrase, “I voted Republican and all I got was this dumb t-shirt,” is a good summation of the disappointment that comes with supporting the feckles...

item.title: Sen. Ron Johnson Asks DOJ To Investigate Judge Accused Of Misconduct In Trump Lawyers’ Trial
item.description: A judge with a 'grudge' against one of the defendants allegedly ghostwrote Wisconsin Judge John Hyland's August order denying a dismissal motion.

item.title: If Time Magazine Weren’t So Corrupt, It Would Have Made Charlie Kirk Person Of The Year
item.description: TIME could have used the credibility that choosing him would have helped restore.

item.title: ADF: Employees Can’t Be Forced To Lie About Pronouns At Work
item.description: Employees don't have to insist on calling people by pronouns they don’t like. But they don’t have to say something they know is not true.

item.title: Pritzker Signs Law Welcoming State-Sanctioned Suicide To Illinois
item.description: State-sanctioned euthanasia not only pressures patients to choose suicide, but also inevitably ends in health care systems forcing suicide on patients...

item.title: Winners and Losers in a World Without Quarterly Earnings
item.description: Clare Flynn Levy reflects on how reduced reporting frequency would alter real-world investment decisions, influencing which firms gain or fall behind....

item.title: AI in Venture Capital: Separating Signal from Noise
item.description: A simple framework helps VC investors assess and identify durable long-term value when investing capital in AI. The post AI in Venture Capital: Separa...

item.title: Corporate Myopia: Less-Frequent Reporting Won’t Reduce Managerial Short-Termism
item.description: Evidence shows quarterly reporting is not the cause of corporate myopia. Incentive structures exert far greater pressure. The post Corporate Myopia: L...

item.title: The Two AI Stories: Measurable Gains and Hidden Balance-Sheet Pressure
item.description: AI is boosting productivity, yet circular financing and concentrated capital flows raise valuation and balance-sheet risks. The post The Two AI Storie...

item.title: Reducing the Cost of Alpha: A CIO’s Framework for Human+AI Integration
item.description: How CIOs can slash costs, scale alpha, and modernize their investment engine with a high-impact Human+AI strategy. The post Reducing the Cost of Alpha...
